int getJoystickPos (JoystickEvent::Joystick joy, float *pos, int numaxes)
 To get the current axis positions of the joystick. The position of an axis can be in the range -1.0 to 1.0, where positive values represent right, forward or up directions, while negative values represent left, back or down directions. If a requested axis is not supported by the joystick, the corresponding array element will be set to zero. The same goes for the situation when the joystick is not connected (all axes are treated as unsupported).
int getJoystickButtons (JoystickEvent::Joystick joy, uint8 *buttons, int numbuttons)
 To get the current buttonsof the joystick. the buttons argument can be either 1 or 0, telling if the corresponding button is currently held down or not. Unsupported buttons will have the value 0.

Detailed Description

Input Handle from the keyboard, mouse, joystick and Window.

Member Function Documentation

int F2C::Input::getJoystickButtons ( JoystickEvent::Joystick  joy,
uint8 *  buttons,
int  numbuttons 
)

To get the current buttonsof the joystick. the buttons argument can be either 1 or 0, telling if the corresponding button is currently held down or not. Unsupported buttons will have the value 0.

Parameters:
joy Joystick nummer
buttons Target reference variable: Array in which all the buttons.
numbuttons Gibt an, wie viele tasten zurueckgegeben werden.
Returns:
returns the state of joystick buttons instead of axis positions.

JoystickEvent::ParamJoystick  param 
)

getMethode: Value of Joystick Param.

Parameters:
joy Joystick nummer
param Joystick Param
int F2C::Input::getJoystickPos ( JoystickEvent::Joystick  joy,
float *  pos,
int  numaxes 
)

To get the current axis positions of the joystick. The position of an axis can be in the range -1.0 to 1.0, where positive values represent right, forward or up directions, while negative values represent left, back or down directions. If a requested axis is not supported by the joystick, the corresponding array element will be set to zero. The same goes for the situation when the joystick is not connected (all axes are treated as unsupported).

Parameters:
joy Joystick nummer
pos Target reference variable: Array in which all the axis positions.
numaxes Numbers of axes
Returns:
returns the actual number of axes that were returned, which could be less than numaxes if the joystick does not support all the requested axes, or if the joystick is not connected.

void F2C::Input::updateRepeat ( int  frame  ) 

update Repeat Handle,this function should only be called once per frame.
Exit function, if the current frame is equal to the last frame.
e.g. (when you use F2C::Window and UpdateGLScreen())

Parameters:
frame current frame 

        F2C::Window WinApp;
        F2C::Input InApp;
        InApp.updateRepeat(WinApp.getFrame());
